intro: Castilleja gyroloba, commonly known as the yellow owl's clover, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and leafless stems. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It forms symbiotic relationships with other plants, drawing nutrients through its root system. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native ecosystems.
